We're here and we have to try to chat each other nicely


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> ALRIGHT! Enough of this attitude, might I state it is rather rude! 
> 
> The idea of a movie, is rather high I think. Some I have heard of 
in the past 
> have been nothing but rumors, little have I seen it as an official 
statement 
> by Hasbro. & with the boom of Transformers & their major 
popularity, & those 
> in charge of the movie project, I state it as a high probability. 
As this has 
> been a topic for a while on some of the Transformers Forums & 
possibly at the 
> BotCons. Supply & demand. 
> 
> Opinions are & will be voiced. If you don't agree with them, then 
don't shoot 
> down someone for it. Let alone the use of name calling & foul 
language. It's 
> bad sportsmanship. 
> 
> Stac
> 
> 
> In a message dated 6/12/03 8:48:14 PM Central Daylight Time, 
> hollywood.narrator@v... writes:
> 
> 
> > OOC: Tankor is a dick no matter what he says.
> >  
> > And I don't give a shit what any of you think about that.
> >  
> > 
> > >> ----- Original Message ----- 
> >> From: <A HREF="mailto:lordofdarkness11001@y...">Tankor</A> 
> >> To: <A 
HREF="mailto:nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com">nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com</A>

> >> Hollywood Narrator <<A 
HREF="mailto:hollywood.narrator@v...">hollywood.narrator@v...</A>> 
wrote: 
> >> >>> OOC: This mail is going to seem VERY angry. All of my mails 
do anyway, 
> >>> please remember.
> >>>  
> >>> I honestly don't understand why this is great news. Whenever 
they announce 
> >>> stuff like this, I just become worried. VERY worried. What 
happens if it 
> >>> sucks? I'll be VERY mad indeed. I think it'll be great news 
when the movie 
> >>> is out and DOESN'T suck. I'm honestly more excited about their 
next line of 
> >>> Transformers for 2004, their 20th anniversary line entitled 
Transformers 
> >>> Energon. I KNOW their toys will always be good. In case you 
don't understand 
> >>> where I'm coming from, I thought Beast Wars was a good show. 
It pailed in 
> >>> comparison to the original Transformers, but it was good. 
However, it could 
> >>> have been SO much better as just an ordinary cartoon like the 
original 
> >>> Transformers instead of computer generation. So the idea 
behind a live action 
> >>> movie makes me think things like "who's writing it? What's the 
budget? Will 
> >>> Hasbro watch over it? Will they make it as bad an adaptation 
as The Running 
> >>> Man?" I know you're all thinking that I should be more 
optimistic, but 
> >>> you've seen how characters can be completely warped, as proof 
of it occurred 
> >>> in Beast Machines. Forgive the fact that this mail was so 
long. Also forgive 
> >>> the fact that I'm still working on my upcoming storylines.
> >>>  
> >>> 
> >>> >>>> ----- Original Message -----
